etymologies: late Middle English: from Old French sirop or medieval Latin siropus, from Arabic šarāb ‘beverage’; compare with sherbet and shrub

definitions: a thick sweet liquid made by dissolving sugar in boiling water, often used for preserving fruit.
shortDefinitions: thick sweet liquid made by dissolving sugar in boiling water

definitions: a thick sweet liquid containing medicine or used as a drink
shortDefinitions: thick sweet liquid containing medicine or used as drink

definitions: a thick sticky liquid derived from a sugar-rich plant, especially sugar cane, corn, and maple.
shortDefinitions: thick sticky liquid derived from sugar-rich plant

definitions: excessive sweetness or sentimentality of style or manner

examples.text: Mr. Gurney's poems are almost all of them syrup

shortDefinitions: excessive sweetness or sentimentality of style or manner
